definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

the right of immunity from arrest afforded by the Taiwan ROC Constitution, for the duration of meetings, unless caught actually committing a crime, to members of the National Assembly, the Legislative Yuan, or a supervisory committee

sentences.english: In order to protect own privilege, their special attention family status.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保護自己的特權，他們特別注意門第。

sentences.english: No organization or individual is privileged to be beyond the Constitution or the law.
sentences.chinese: 任何組織或者個人都不得有超越憲法和法律的特權。

sentences.english: Concubinage is still the privilege of the rich class, but there still exist the phenomenon that the civilian concubinage.
sentences.chinese: 納妾雖屬於富貴階層的特權，但平民納妾也不在少數。

sentences.english: To create a new user account, you need administrator privileges.
sentences.chinese: 要創建一個新的用戶帳戶，您需要有管理員特權。

sentences.english: Now remember, these visits to Hogsmeade village are a privilege.
sentences.chinese: 大家記住能夠參觀霍格莫德是一種特權。

sentences.english: A hegemonic country obtains privileged interests from currency hegemony, but pays costs too.
sentences.chinese: 霸權國不僅獲取特權利益，也付出成本。

sentences.english: Who has the right to be within the system of power and righteousness?
sentences.chinese: 誰有特權處在威勢赫赫的體制內部？

sentences.english: TO CREATE life is the prerogative of gods.
sentences.chinese: 製造生命向來是上帝的特權。

sentences.english: Taking personal breaks shouldn’t be an exclusive privilege for managers.
sentences.chinese: 利用個人休息時間不應是經理們獨有的特權。

sentences.english: The tenants of the demesne enjoyed certain privileges .
sentences.chinese: 領地的佔有者享有一定的特權。

sentences.english: This is the prerogative and knowledge of the Creator Sons, and the Universe Mothers.
sentences.chinese: 這是造物主之子和宇宙之母的特權與知識。

sentences.english: If you later undo the action, ensure you have a process that revokes any implicit privileges as well.
sentences.chinese: 如果以後撤銷這個動作，那麼應撤銷任何隱式的特權。

sentences.english: The abrogation of his privileges made him an ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 特權的取消使他成爲了平民。

sentences.english: They also object to giving the president and his family any immunity from prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他們還拒絕給予總統及其家人任何免於起訴的特權。

sentences.english: It has always been the special prerogative of young people to look and act weird and shock grown-ups.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人總有特權行爲怪異而使成年人震驚。

sentences.english: Use always customized users with very limited privileges.
sentences.chinese: 總是使用只有有限特權的定製用戶。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to have the right to/to be entitled to/to have authority/powerful
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
